in the current release and then the the more complicated change is something

container container image full of debug tools or really whatever you want
inside of an existing running pod so this makes it super easy to have

G visor is is a user space kernel effectively it implements a lot of the
Linux system surface it has this notion of a platform which it needs to
intercept system calls or basically run some application there are two platforms
the peach raised platform which works a lot like UML for people who are familiar with UML sort of classic so it uses sis
EMU to run things and the KBM platform which uses hardware virtualization features so it doesn't incur such a
heavy cost for doing all that interception everything happens in user space was sort of emulating what the
system surface looks like to applications it's not exposing any of the hosts kernel details the user space
kernel does run on top of the host kernel though and the reason it's a reimplementation versus something like
your mother big difference is that it's aware that it's a user space kernel and it's not actually providing like a fixed
resource footprint for these applications so if you have an application that needs 10 makes a memory you're running in G visor it'll use 10
